awd_titl_txt: Travel: Student Travel Grant for 2023 Formal Methods in Computer-Aided Design (FMCAD)
awd_abstract_narration:
Formal Methods in Computer Aided Design (FMCAD) 2023 is the twenty-third in a series of conferences on the theory and applications of formal methods in hardware and system verification. It provides a leading forum to researchers in academia and industry for presenting and discussing ground-breaking methods, technologies, theoretical results, and tools for reasoning formally about computing systems. This grant will help support conference travel for up to 15 students enrolled in US institutions to attend FMCAD in Ames, Iowa, USA. The students will get the opportunity to present at the Student Forum, which is a platform for graduate students at any career stage to introduce their research to the wider formal methods research community, and solicit feedback. 

The field of formal methods is being rapidly deployed in a variety of areas both in academic research, as well as in industrial systems. Thus the broader significance and importance include fostering the next generation of researchers in this research area, as well as providing international experiences to build a globally-aware workforce. In particular, students will have the opportunity to present at the Student Forum, learn state-of-the-art methodologies, be exposed to novel techniques, and interact with senior researchers in their areas of expertise. The organizers will give priority to students from under-represented groups and from small universities without a formal methods program.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
This grant served to support the participation of students (including both graduate and undergraduate) in the 2023 international conference on Formal Methods in Computer-Aided Design (FMCAD) and its co-located events. Co-located events included VSTTE 2023 – the 15th Working Conference on Verified Software: Theories, Tools, and Experiments; a shared FMCAD/VSTTE tutorial day with tutorials on emergent tools and technologies that particularly appeal to students; and the Student Forum, a platform for graduate students at any career stage to introduce their research to the wider Formal Methods community, and solicit feedback. These events were held in Ames, Iowa, USA, from October 23 to October 27, 2023.


The FMCAD Student Forum chairs originally allocated all of the grant funding to cover the travel and registration costs of nine US students plus registration costs for ten "local" (within driving distance) students. These students benefited greatly from the opportunities provided to interact with prominent researchers from the international research community, present their papers and/or posters, receive feedback, ask questions, learn new tools and technologies, and grow in their ability to participate in scientific research. We were particularly pleased with the successful inclusion of undergraduate researchers as well as graduate students. FMCAD provides a supportive environment inclusive of all students, and conducive to learning.
